content.description: The name says it all. This would have more stars but at the crux there is a big loose flake that will eventually rip off. Climb up the blocky start then into the bottom of the flake. Reach high up to the right and grab the top of the flake below the 3rd bolt. Then mantle over the bulge and up to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts to bolted anchor.(As of right now there is only hangers)

climbs.name: Rum Diaries
climbs.fa: Jonathan Garlough, James Dickson & Shane Soucy

content.description: The climb is located on the far right side of the Atta-Scrap Wall. Climb the steep wall past 4 bolts on gold holds to a crux at the top. Finish at a two bolt anchor on top.

Start in the giant right angling ramp/corner system passing 3 bolts to a ledge stance. Clip a bolt and fight the offwidth to gain a finger lock, slopers, and eventually a jug! Place gear and finish easily to a ring anchor.

The climb starts left of the other bolted line, Hot Fortuna near the center of the cliff. Climb the shallow groove following a flake to a bulge. Make the crux moves over the bulge on thin crimps and top out. Rap from the tree.

climbs.name: Hot Fortuna
climbs.fa: James Dickson, Jonathan Garlough & Shane Soucy

content.description: The climb is located about 50' right of obvious corner of Goldrush. Climb the sustained near vertical face past four bolts to a small ledge. Sling the birch and finish up 40' of low angle super fun 5.5ish arete/crack climbing to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts on the steep face, cams to #2 for the top. Use a tree for now...

content.description: Goldrush climbs the big left facing corner on the Atta-Scrap Wall. The climb looks like a mini version of crack in the woods. Climb the corner up to the roof. Traverse left out the roof and make a hard semi blind placement (#1 worked). Move up and clip a bolt that protects the exciting finish. A bolt anchor awaits on top.
content.location: Goldrush is located on the "Atta-Scrap Wall". This wall is located below the main cliff. Walk right along the base of the low angle slab below the main wall to a gully that runs up the right edge of the slab. This will bring you to the left side of the Atta-Scrap Wall.

content.description: Freakers Ball climbs the shallow left facing corner to the left of the large corner of Goldrush. Climb up to a bolt then follow the corner angling right and placing gear to a small foot ledge. Reach out right and clip the bolt at the top of Goldrush. Finish up to the bolt anchor above.
content.location: Freakers Ball is located on the "Atta-Scrap Wall". This wall is located below the main cliff. Walk right along the base of the low angle slab below the main wall to a gully that runs up the right edge of the slab. This will bring you to the left side of the Atta-Scrap Wall.

climbs.name: Exclusiva
climbs.fa: Jonathan Garlough, James Dickson & Shane Soucy

content.description: The climb is located in the corner/ face system on the left edge of the overhanging wall on the right end of the Atta-Scrap Wall. Climb the corner/face with increasing difficulty past four bolts to a ledge and a ring anchor.

climbs.name: Crash Course
climbs.fa: Jonathan Garlough, Chris Magness & James Dickson

content.description: This climb is located between Goldrush and Freakers Ball. Climb the thin seam placing gear past a pin and a bomber nut. Join Freakers Ball at the top (bolt) and finish at the bolt anchor.
content.protection: nuts, pin, cams, bolt, bolt anchor
content.location: Below the Main cliff on the Atta-scrap wall.   Between Goldrush and Freakers Ball

content.description: Newly developing smaller wall with some nice short climbs on it.   It's in the trees so slow drying.
